AccountPermissions.name: approveTargetForSigner
AccountPermissions.summary: Approve an address as a call target for a given signer on the account
AccountPermissions.remarks: Approves an address as a call target for a given signer on the account.

examples.javascript:
const tx = await contract.account.approveTargetForSigner(signer, target);
const receipt = tx.receipt();

AccountPermissions.name: disapproveTargetForSigner
AccountPermissions.summary: Disapprove an address as a call target for a given signer on the account
AccountPermissions.remarks: Disapprove an address as a call target for a given signer on the account.

examples.javascript:
const tx = await contract.account.disapproveTargetForSigner(signer, target);
const receipt = tx.receipt();

AccountPermissions.name: grantAdminPermissions
AccountPermissions.summary: Grant an address admin access to the account.
AccountPermissions.remarks: Grants an address admin access to the account. The admin will have complete authority over the account.

examples.javascript:
const tx = await contract.account.grantAdminAccess(signer);
const receipt = tx.receipt();

AccountPermissions.name: grantPermissions
AccountPermissions.summary: Grant a signer permissions to use the account.
AccountPermissions.remarks: Grants a signer permissions to use the account.

examples.javascript:
const tx = await contract.account.grantPermissions(signer, permissions);
const receipt = tx.receipt();

AccountPermissions.name: resetAllPermissions
AccountPermissions.summary: Set the account's entire snapshot of permissions.
AccountPermissions.remarks: Sets the account's entire snapshot of permissions.

examples.javascript:
const tx = await contract.account.setAccess(permissionSnapshot);
const receipt = tx.receipt();

AccountPermissions.name: revokeAccess
AccountPermissions.summary: Revoke a scoped access address to the account
AccountPermissions.remarks: Revokes an address' access to the account.

examples.javascript:
const tx = await contract.account.revokeAccess(signer);
const receipt = tx.receipt();

AccountPermissions.name: revokeAdminPermissions
AccountPermissions.summary: Revoke an address' admin access to the account.
AccountPermissions.remarks: Revokes an address' admin access to the account.

examples.javascript:
const tx = await contract.account.revokeAdminAccess(signer);
const receipt = tx.receipt();

AccountPermissions.name: updatePermissions
AccountPermissions.summary: Update the permissions of a signer for using the account.
AccountPermissions.remarks: Updates the permissions of a signer for using the account.

examples.javascript:
const tx = await contract.account.updateAccess(signer, restrictions);
const receipt = tx.receipt();

AccountPermissions.name: getAllAdmins
AccountPermissions.summary: Get all admins of the account.

examples.javascript: const allAdmins = await contract.account.getAllAdmins();

AccountPermissions.name: getAllAdminsAndSigners
AccountPermissions.summary: Get all admins and non-admin signers with permissions to use the account.

examples.javascript: const allAdminsAndSigners = await contract.account.getAllAdminsAndSigners();

AccountPermissions.name: getAllSigners
AccountPermissions.summary: Get all (non-admin) signers with permissions to use the account.

examples.javascript: const allSigners = await contract.account.getAllSigners();

AccountPermissions.name: isAdmin
AccountPermissions.summary: Get whether a signer is an admin on the account.

examples.javascript: const isAdmin = await contract.account.isAdmin(signer);

AccountPermissions.name: isSigner
AccountPermissions.summary: Get whether a signer has permissions to use the account.

examples.javascript: const isAdmin = await contract.account.isSigner(signer);

AccountFactory.name: createAccount
AccountFactory.remarks: Create a account for an admin. The admin will have complete authority over the account.

examples.javascript: const allAccounts = await contract.accountFactory.getAllAccounts();

AccountFactory.name: getAssociatedAccounts
AccountFactory.summary: Get all accounts on which the given signer has authority

examples.javascript: const allAccounts = await contract.accountFactory.getAssociatedAccounts(admin);

AccountFactory.name: predictAccountAddress
AccountFactory.summary: Get the deterministic address of the account that will be created

examples.javascript: const accountAddress = await contract.accountFactory.predictAccountAddress(admin);

const appURI = "ipfs://some_ipfs_hash";
await contract.app.set(appURI);

const appURI = await contract.app.get();
console.log(appURI) // "ipfs://some_ipfs_hash";

ContractMetadata.name: set
ContractMetadata.summary: Set the metadata of this contract
ContractMetadata.remarks: OVERWRITE the metadata of a contract

ContractMetadata.name: update
ContractMetadata.summary: Update the metadata of a contract
ContractMetadata.remarks: Update the metadata of a contract

ContractMetadata.name: get
ContractMetadata.summary: Get the metadata of this contract
ContractMetadata.remarks: Get the metadata of a contract

examples.javascript:
const metadata = await contract.metadata.get();
console.log(metadata);

Ownable.name: set
Ownable.summary: Set the new owner of the contract
Ownable.remarks: Can only be called by the current owner.

examples.javascript:
const newOwnerAddress = "{{wallet_address}}";
await contract.owner.set(newOwnerAddress);

Ownable.name: get
Ownable.summary: Get the current owner of the contract

examples.javascript:
await contract.owner.get();
console.log("Owner address: ", ownerAddress);

PlatformFee.name: set
PlatformFee.summary: Set the platform fee recipient and basis points

PlatformFee.name: get
PlatformFee.summary: Get the platform fee recipient and basis points

examples.javascript: await contract.sales.setRecipient(recipientWalletAddress);
const salesRecipient = await contract.sales.getRecipient();

Permissions.name: grant
Permissions.summary: Grant a role to a specific address
Permissions.remarks: Make sure you are sure you want to grant the role to the address.

examples.javascript: await contract.roles.grant("minter", "{{wallet_address}}");

Permissions.name: revoke
Permissions.summary: Revoke a role from a specific address
Permissions.remarks:
-- Caution --

This will let you remove yourself from the role, too. If you remove yourself from the admin role, you will no longer be able to administer the contract. There is no way to recover from this.

examples.javascript: await contract.roles.revoke("minter", "{{wallet_address}}");

Permissions.name: setAll
Permissions.summary: Overwrite the list of members for specific roles
Permissions.remarks: Every role in the list will be overwritten with the new list of addresses provided with them. If you want to add or remove addresses for a single address use {@link ContractRoles.grant} and {@link ContractRoles.revoke} respectively instead.

Permissions.name: get
Permissions.summary: Get all members of a specific role
Permissions.remarks: See {@link ContractRoles.getAll} to get get a list of addresses for all supported roles on the contract.

examples.javascript: const minterAddresses = await contract.roles.get("minter");

PermissionsEnumerable.name: getAll
PermissionsEnumerable.summary: Get all members of all roles
PermissionsEnumerable.remarks: See {@link ContractRoles.get} to get a list of addresses that are members of a specific role.

examples.javascript: const rolesAndMembers = await contract.roles.getAll();

Royalty.name: setDefaultRoyaltyInfo
Royalty.summary: Set the royalty recipient and fee

Royalty.name: setTokenRoyaltyInfo
Royalty.summary: Set the royalty recipient and fee for a particular token

Royalty.name: getDefaultRoyaltyInfo
Royalty.summary: Get the royalty recipient and fee

Royalty.name: getTokenRoyaltyInfo
Royalty.summary: Get the royalty recipient and fee of a particular token

ERC1155Burnable.remarks: Burn the specified NFTs from a specified wallet

ERC1155ClaimCustom.name: claim
ERC1155ClaimCustom.remarks: Let the connected wallet claim NFTs.

examples.javascript:
const tokenId = 0; // the id of the NFT you want to claim
const quantity = 1; // how many NFTs you want to claim

const tx = await contract.erc1155.claim(tokenId, quantity);
const receipt = tx.receipt; // the transaction receipt

const quantity = 1; // how many NFTs you want to claim

const tx = await contract.erc1155.claimTo(address, tokenId, quantity);
const receipt = tx.receipt; // the transaction receipt

ERC1155LazyMintableV1.name: lazyMint
ERC1155LazyMintableV1.remarks: Create batch allows you to create a batch of many NFTs in one transaction.

ERC1155LazyMintableV2.name: lazyMint
ERC1155LazyMintableV2.remarks: Create batch allows you to create a batch of many NFTs in one transaction.

ERC1155Mintable.name: mint
ERC1155Mintable.remarks: Mint an NFT with a limited supply to the connected wallet.

ERC1155Mintable.name: mintAdditionalSupply
ERC1155Mintable.summary: Increase the supply of an existing NFT
ERC1155Mintable.remarks: Increase the supply of an existing NFT and mint it to the connected wallet address

ERC1155Mintable.name: mintTo
ERC1155Mintable.summary: Mint an NFT to a specific wallet
ERC1155Mintable.remarks: Mint an NFT with a limited supply to a specified wallet.

ERC1155BatchMintable.name: mintBatch
ERC1155BatchMintable.remarks: Mint multiple different NFTs with limited supplies to the connected wallet.

ERC1155BatchMintable.name: mintBatchTo
ERC1155BatchMintable.summary: Mint multiple NFTs at once to a specific wallet
ERC1155BatchMintable.remarks: Mint multiple different NFTs with limited supplies to a specified wallet.

ERC1155Revealable.name: revealer
ERC1155Revealable.remarks: Create a batch of encrypted NFTs that can be revealed at a later time.

ERC1155.name: setApprovalForAll
ERC1155.remarks: Approve or remove operator as an operator for the caller. Operators can call transferFrom or safeTransferFrom for any token owned by the caller.

examples.javascript:
const operator = "{{wallet_address}}";
await contract.erc1155.setApprovalForAll(operator, true);

ERC1155.name: transfer
ERC1155.remarks: Transfer an NFT from the connected wallet to another wallet.

ERC1155.name: transferFrom
ERC1155.summary: Transfer an NFT from a specific wallet
ERC1155.remarks: Transfer an NFT from a specific wallet to another wallet.

ERC1155.name: balanceOf
ERC1155.summary: Get NFT balance of a specific wallet
ERC1155.remarks: Get a wallets NFT balance (number of NFTs in this contract owned by the wallet).

examples.javascript:
const tokenId = 0;
const nft = await contract.erc1155.get(tokenId);

ERC1155.name: totalSupply
ERC1155.summary: Get the total supply of a specific token

examples.javascript:
const tokenId = 0;
const nft = await contract.erc1155.totalSupply(tokenId);

ERC1155SignatureMintable.name: signature
ERC1155SignatureMintable.remarks: Generate dynamic NFTs with your own signature, and let others mint them using that signature.

ERC1155SignatureMintable.name: mint
ERC1155SignatureMintable.remarks: Mint a dynamic NFT with a previously generated signature.

ERC1155SignatureMintable.name: mintBatch
ERC1155SignatureMintable.summary: Mint any number of dynamically generated NFT at once
ERC1155SignatureMintable.remarks: Mint multiple dynamic NFTs in one transaction. Note that this is only possible for free mints (cannot batch mints with a price attached to it for security reasons)

ERC1155SignatureMintable.name: generate
ERC1155SignatureMintable.summary: Generate a signature that can be used to mint an NFT dynamically.
ERC1155SignatureMintable.remarks: Takes in an NFT and some information about how it can be minted, uploads the metadata and signs it with your private key. The generated signature can then be used to mint an NFT using the exact payload and signature generated.

ERC1155SignatureMintable.name: generateFromTokenId
ERC1155SignatureMintable.summary: Generate a signature that can be used to mint additionally supply to an existing NFT.
ERC1155SignatureMintable.remarks: Takes in a payload with the token ID of an existing NFT, and signs it with your private key. The generated signature can then be used to mint additional supply to the NFT using the exact payload and signature generated.

ERC1155SignatureMintable.name: verify
ERC1155SignatureMintable.summary: Verify that a payload is correctly signed

ERC1155Enumerable.name: getAll
ERC1155Enumerable.remarks:
Get all the data associated with every NFT in this contract.

By default, returns the first 100 NFTs, use queryParams to fetch more.

examples.javascript: const nfts = await contract.erc1155.getAll();

ERC1155Enumerable.name: getOwned
ERC1155Enumerable.summary: Get all NFTs owned by a specific wallet
ERC1155Enumerable.remarks: Get all the data associated with the NFTs owned by a specific wallet.

ERC1155Enumerable.name: totalCount
ERC1155Enumerable.summary: Get the total number of NFTs minted
ERC1155Enumerable.remarks: This returns the total number of NFTs minted in this contract, **not** the total supply of a given token.

examples.javascript:
const count = await contract.erc1155.totalCount();
console.log(count);

ERC20Mintable.name: mintTo
ERC20Mintable.summary: Mint tokens to a specific wallet
ERC20Mintable.remarks: Mint tokens to a specified address.

ERC20BatchMintable.name: mintBatchTo

ERC20.name: setAllowance
ERC20.remarks: Allows the specified `spender` wallet to transfer the given `amount` of tokens to another wallet

ERC20.name: transfer
ERC20.remarks: Transfer tokens from the connected wallet to another wallet.

ERC20.name: transferFrom
ERC20.summary: Transfer tokens from a specific address
ERC20.remarks: Transfer tokens from one wallet to another

ERC20.name: allowance
ERC20.remarks: Get the allowance of a 'spender' wallet over the connected wallet's funds - the allowance of a different address for a token is the amount of tokens that the `spender` wallet is allowed to spend on behalf of the connected wallet.

ERC20.name: allowanceOf
ERC20.summary: Get token allowance of a specific wallet
ERC20.remarks: Get the allowance of one wallet over another wallet's funds - the allowance of a different address for a token is the amount of tokens that the wallet is allowed to spend on behalf of the specified wallet.

ERC20.name: balance
ERC20.summary: Get token balance for the currently connected wallet

examples.javascript: const balance = await contract.erc20.balance();

ERC20.name: balanceOf
ERC20.summary: Get token balance for a specific wallet

examples.javascript:
const walletAddress = "{{wallet_address}}";
const balance = await contract.erc20.balanceOf(walletAddress);
const token = await contract.erc20.get();

ERC20.name: totalSupply
ERC20.summary: Get the total supply for this token
ERC20.remarks: Get how much supply has been minted

examples.javascript: const balance = await contract.erc20.totalSupply();

ERC20SignatureMintable.name: signature
ERC20SignatureMintable.remarks: Generate dynamic tokens with your own signature, and let others mint them using that signature.

ERC20SignatureMintable.name: mint
ERC20SignatureMintable.remarks: Mint a certain amount of tokens from a previously generated signature.

ERC20SignatureMintable.name: generate
ERC20SignatureMintable.summary: Generate a signature that can be used to mint a certain amount of tokens
ERC20SignatureMintable.remarks: Takes in a quantity of tokens, some conditions for how it can be minted and signs it with your private key. The generated signature can then be used to mint those tokens using the exact payload and signature generated.

name: transferBatch
remarks: Mint tokens from the connected wallet to many wallets

name: totalCount
summary: Get the total number of NFTs minted
remarks: This returns the total number of NFTs minted in this contract, **not** the total supply of a given token.

examples.javascript:
const count = await contract.erc721.totalCount();
console.log(count);

name: createListingsBatch
summary: Create a batch of new listings
remarks: Create a batch of new listings on the marketplace

examples.javascript:
const listings = [...];
const tx = await contract.directListings.createListingsBatch(listings);

name: revokeBuyerApprovalForReservedListing
summary: Revoke approval of a buyer for a reserved direct listing

name: createAuctionsBatch
summary: Create a batch of new auctions
remarks: Create a batch of new auctions on the marketplace

examples.javascript:
const auctions = [...];
const tx = await contract.englishAuctions.createAuctionsBatch(auctions);
const result = await contract.erc721.burn(tokenId);

ERC721ClaimCustom.name: claim
ERC721ClaimCustom.remarks: Let the specified wallet claim NFTs.

examples.javascript:
const quantity = 1; // how many unique NFTs you want to claim

const tx = await contract.erc721.claim(quantity);
const receipt = tx.receipt; // the transaction receipt
const claimedTokenId = tx.id; // the id of the NFT claimed
const claimedNFT = await tx.data(); // (optional) get the claimed NFT metadata

ERC721ClaimCustom.remarks: Let the specified wallet claim NFTs.

examples.javascript:

const quantity = 1; // how many unique NFTs you want to claim

const tx = await contract.erc721.claimTo(address, quantity);
const receipt = tx.receipt; // the transaction receipt
const claimedTokenId = tx.id; // the id of the NFT claimed
const claimedNFT = await tx.data(); // (optional) get the claimed NFT metadata

Get the number of claimed NFTs in this Drop.

*

ERC721ClaimPhasesV2.name: claimConditions
ERC721ClaimPhasesV2.remarks: Define who can claim NFTs in the collection, when and how many.

ERC721ClaimPhasesV2.name: claimTo
ERC721ClaimPhasesV2.summary: Claim NFTs to a specific wallet
ERC721ClaimPhasesV2.remarks: Let the specified wallet claim NFTs.

examples.javascript:
const address = "{{wallet_address}}"; // address of the wallet you want to claim the NFTs
const quantity = 1; // how many unique NFTs you want to claim

const tx = await contract.erc721.claimTo(address, quantity);
const receipt = tx.receipt; // the transaction receipt
const claimedTokenId = tx.id; // the id of the NFT claimed
const claimedNFT = await tx.data(); // (optional) get the claimed NFT metadata

ERC721ClaimPhasesV2.name: totalClaimedSupply
ERC721ClaimPhasesV2.remarks:
Get the number of claimed NFTs in this Drop.

*

examples.javascript:
const claimedNFTCount = await contract.totalClaimedSupply();
console.log(`NFTs claimed: ${claimedNFTCount}`);

ERC721ClaimPhasesV2.name: totalUnclaimedSupply
ERC721ClaimPhasesV2.remarks:
Get the number of unclaimed NFTs in this Drop.

*

examples.javascript:
const unclaimedNFTCount = await contract.totalUnclaimedSupply();
console.log(`NFTs left to claim: ${unclaimedNFTCount}`);

ERC721LazyMintable.name: lazyMint
ERC721LazyMintable.remarks: Create batch allows you to create a batch of many unique NFTs in one transaction.

ERC721Mintable.name: mint
ERC721Mintable.remarks: Mint an NFT to the connected wallet.

ERC721Mintable.name: mintTo
ERC721Mintable.summary: Mint an NFT to a specific wallet
ERC721Mintable.remarks: Mint a unique NFT to a specified wallet.

ERC721BatchMintable.name: mintBatch
ERC721BatchMintable.remarks: Mint many unique NFTs at once to the connected wallet

ERC721BatchMintable.name: mintBatchTo
ERC721BatchMintable.summary: Mint many NFTs to a specific wallet
ERC721BatchMintable.remarks: Mint many unique NFTs at once to a specified wallet.

ERC721Revealable.name: revealer
ERC721Revealable.remarks: Create a batch of encrypted NFTs that can be revealed at a later time.

ERC721.name: setApprovalForAll
ERC721.remarks: Approve or remove operator as an operator for the caller. Operators can call transferFrom or safeTransferFrom for any token owned by the caller.

examples.javascript:
const operator = "{{wallet_address}}";
await contract.erc721.setApprovalForAll(operator, true);

ERC721.name: transfer
ERC721.remarks: Transfer an NFT from the connected wallet to another wallet.

ERC721.name: transferFrom
ERC721.summary: Transfer an NFT from a specific wallet
ERC721.remarks: Transfer an NFT from the given wallet to another wallet.

ERC721.name: balanceOf
ERC721.summary: Get NFT balance of a specific wallet
ERC721.remarks: Get a wallets NFT balance (number of NFTs in this contract owned by the wallet).

examples.javascript:
const tokenId = 0;
const nft = await contract.erc721.get(tokenId);

ERC721SharedMetadata.name: sharedMetadata
ERC721SharedMetadata.summary: Set shared metadata for all NFTs
ERC721SharedMetadata.remarks: Set shared metadata for all NFTs in the collection. (Open Edition)

ERC721SignatureMintV1.name: signature
ERC721SignatureMintV1.remarks: Generate dynamic NFTs with your own signature, and let others mint them using that signature.

ERC721SignatureMintV2.name: signature
ERC721SignatureMintV2.remarks: Generate dynamic NFTs with your own signature, and let others mint them using that signature.

ERC721UpdatableMetadata.name: update
ERC721UpdatableMetadata.summary: Update the metadata of an NFT
ERC721UpdatableMetadata.remarks: Update the metadata of an NFT

ERC721Supply.name: getAll
ERC721Supply.remarks:
Get all the data associated with every NFT in this contract.

By default, returns the first 100 NFTs, use queryParams to fetch more.

examples.javascript:
const nfts = await contract.erc721.getAll();
console.log(nfts);

const owners = await contract.erc721.getAllOwners();
console.log(owners);

ERC721Supply.name: getOwned
ERC721Supply.summary: Get all NFTs owned by a specific wallet
ERC721Supply.remarks: Get all the data associated with the NFTs owned by a specific wallet.

ERC721Enumerable.name: getAll
ERC721Enumerable.remarks:
Get all the data associated with every NFT in this contract.

By default, returns the first 100 NFTs, use queryParams to fetch more.

examples.javascript:
const nfts = await contract.erc721.getAll();
console.log(nfts);

const owners = await contract.erc721.getAllOwners();
console.log(owners);

ERC721Enumerable.name: getOwned
ERC721Enumerable.summary: Get all NFTs owned by a specific wallet
ERC721Enumerable.remarks: Get all the data associated with the NFTs owned by a specific wallet.

ERC721SignatureMint.name: mint
ERC721SignatureMint.remarks: Mint a dynamic NFT with a previously generated signature.

ERC721SignatureMint.name: generate
ERC721SignatureMint.summary: Generate a signature that can be used to mint a dynamic NFT
ERC721SignatureMint.remarks: Takes in an NFT and some information about how it can be minted, uploads the metadata and signs it with your private key. The generated signature can then be used to mint an NFT using the exact payload and signature generated.

ERC721SignatureMint.name: verify
ERC721SignatureMint.summary: Verify that a payload is correctly signed

DirectListings.name: approveBuyerForReservedListing
DirectListings.summary: Approve buyer for a reserved direct listing
DirectListings.remarks: Approve a buyer to buy from a reserved listing.

DirectListings.name: approveCurrencyForListing
DirectListings.summary: Approve a currency for a direct listing

DirectListings.name: buyFromListing
DirectListings.summary: Buy direct listing for a specific wallet
DirectListings.remarks: Buy from a specific direct listing from the marketplace.

DirectListings.name: cancelListing
DirectListings.remarks: Cancel a direct listing on the marketplace

DirectListings.name: createListing
DirectListings.remarks: Create a new listing on the marketplace where people can buy an asset directly.

DirectListings.name: revokeCurrencyApprovalForListing
DirectListings.summary: Revoke approval of a currency for a direct listing

DirectListings.name: currencyPriceForListing
DirectListings.summary: Check price per token for an approved currency

examples.javascript: const listings = await contract.directListings.getAll();

DirectListings.name: getAllValid
DirectListings.remarks: A valid listing is where the listing is active, and the creator still owns & has approved Marketplace to transfer the listed NFTs.

examples.javascript: const listings = await contract.directListings.getAllValid();

const listingId = 0;
const listing = await contract.directListings.getListing(listingId);

DirectListings.name: getTotalCount
DirectListings.summary: Get the total number of direct listings

examples.javascript: const totalListings = await contract.directListings.getTotalCount();

DirectListings.name: isBuyerApprovedForListing
DirectListings.summary: Check if a buyer is approved for a specific direct listing

examples.javascript:
const listingId = 0;
const isBuyerApproved = await contract.directListings.isBuyerApprovedForListing(listingId, "{{wallet_address}}");

DirectListings.name: isCurrencyApprovedForListing
DirectListings.summary: Check if a currency is approved for a specific direct listing

EnglishAuctions.name: buyoutAuction
EnglishAuctions.remarks: Buy a specific auction from the marketplace.

EnglishAuctions.name: cancelAuction
EnglishAuctions.remarks: Cancel an auction on the marketplace

EnglishAuctions.name: closeAuctionForBidder
EnglishAuctions.summary: Close the english auction for the bidder
EnglishAuctions.remarks: Closes the Auction and executes the sale for the buyer.

EnglishAuctions.name: closeAuctionForSeller
EnglishAuctions.summary: Close the english auction for the seller
EnglishAuctions.remarks: Closes the Auction and executes the sale for the seller.

EnglishAuctions.name: createAuction
EnglishAuctions.remarks: Create a new auction where people can bid on an asset.

EnglishAuctions.name: executeSale
EnglishAuctions.summary: Close the english auction for both the seller and the bidder
EnglishAuctions.remarks: Closes the Auction and executes the sale for both parties.

EnglishAuctions.name: makeBid
EnglishAuctions.remarks: Make a bid on an auction

examples.javascript: const auctions = await contract.englishAuctions.getAll();
const auctions = await contract.englishAuctions.getAllValid();

const auctionId = 0;
const auction = await contract.englishAuctions.getAuction(auctionId);

EnglishAuctions.name: getBidBufferBps
EnglishAuctions.summary: Get the buffer for an english auction

EnglishAuctions.name: getMinimumNextBid
EnglishAuctions.summary: Get the minimum next bid for an english auction

EnglishAuctions.name: getTotalCount
EnglishAuctions.summary: Get the total number of english auctions

examples.javascript: const totalAuctions = await contract.englishAuctions.getTotalCount();

EnglishAuctions.name: getWinner
EnglishAuctions.summary: Get the winner for a specific english auction
EnglishAuctions.remarks: Get the winner of the auction after an auction ends.

EnglishAuctions.name: getWinningBid
EnglishAuctions.summary: Get winning bid of an english auction
EnglishAuctions.remarks: Get the current highest bid of an active auction.

EnglishAuctions.name: isWinningBid
EnglishAuctions.summary: Check if a bid is or will be a winning bid

Offers.name: cancelOffer
Offers.remarks: Cancel an offer on the marketplace

Offers.name: makeOffer
Offers.remarks: Make an offer on the marketplace for an asset.

examples.javascript: const offers = await contract.offers.getAll();
const offers = await contract.offers.getAllValid();

const offerId = 0;
const offer = await contract.offers.getOffer(offerId);

Offers.name: getTotalCount
Offers.summary: Get the total number of offers

examples.javascript: const totalOffers = await contract.offers.getTotalCount();
